title: Northern Ireland Assembly election reaction - BBC News

dup is still biggest party , but sinn fein closes gap .
for first time , unionists wo n't have overall majority .
sinn fein 's share of first preference votes up by 4 % .
ulster unionist leader mike nesbitt resigns .

documents.title: sdlp performance 'victory for devolution '
text: sdlp leader colum eastwood says his party 's performance in the election was `` a victory for those who chose devolution over direct rule , for those who want power-sharing to work '' .
`` it is now incumbent on all parties to ensure that power is retained in our assembly , not handed back to theresa may and james brokenshire , '' he said .

documents.title: election colour : breakdown of votes
text: here 's how the first preference votes broke down :

documents.title: now focus on forming executive - cbi
text: the confederation of british industry ( cbi ) says following the election mlas must refocus their efforts on forming a functioning devolved executive .

`` to successfully steer us through this challenging period , and facilitate the creation of a competitive economy that can generate 50,000 new jobs by 2021 , business needs a fully functioning executive that delivers long term political stability , '' said the cbi 's angela mcgowan .

documents.title: unionist division must end says dup mla
text: newly elected upper bann mla jonathan buckley of the dup says the days of unionist division must end .
`` there has to be closer co-operation for those that are unionist by conviction and want to see the union maintained , '' he says .

documents.title: sdlp leader 'could have backed nesbitt more '
text: sdlp leader colum eastwood could have backed ulster unionist leader mike nesbitt more , party colleague says .
former sdlp mla alban maginnis says @ twitterid could have been more forthright in backing @ twitterid

documents.title: sf td : election result 'decisive not divisive '
text: sinn fein td mary lou mcdonald says her party taking 27 seats in the assembly election was a `` massive affirmation of the politics of sinn fein over the last ten years . ''
speaking on rté radio about her party being just one seat behind the dup , she said : `` this is not a numbers game in terms of unionism versus nationalism .
it 's a real change in the political charge and a decisive moment , not a divisive one . ''

documents.title: uup should take time to new leader - kennedy
text: ulster unionist danny kennedy says mike nesbitt showed great dignity in his resignation and the party should take time to a new leader .
mr kennedy , who lost his seat in newry and armagh , said he had believed a surge in the sinn fein vote was likely ahead of the election and `` ultimately it was that tide that swept us '' .

documents.title: foster 'won election for wrong party '
text: people before profit 's eamonn mccann says that arlene foster won the election `` but won it for the wrong party '' .
he said some of her comments about issues like the irish language `` felt to hundreds of thousands of people as disdain '' and helped to get the vote out for sinn fein .

documents.title: successful candidate running again
text: on the queen 's park run .
fellow-jogger said to me , it 's easy for a crocodile like you to run through the puddles @ twitterid
that 's not a run !
it looks more like a cross country do n't you just love rain and mud !
jealous ! ! !
enjoy !

documents.title: farry : 'danger of drift '
text: alliance 's stephen farry , who was re-elected as an mla in north down , says it 's crucial sinn fein and the dup establish a government in the coming weeks to avoid `` drift '' over forthcoming brexit negotiations .
he said : `` northern ireland is facing its biggest challenge at a time of our greatest weakness , in terms of any notion of clear and coherent government .
and if we do n't have that , then there is the danger of drift . ''

documents.title: mccrea : uup needs to assess its 'relevance '
text: former ni21 leader basil mccrea says the ulster unionist party needs to ask `` where it sees itself in the electoral framework and if there is any relevance to the party '' in the wake of the assembly election results .

the ex-ulster unionist mla , added that the role of the next party leader should be to `` negotiate a settlement with somebody , to find some kind of arrangement with the dup or , potentially , the sdlp '' .

documents.title: return to direct rule 'would be abdication of responsibility '
text: sdlp south belfast mla clare hanna says that with no budget in place and no plans for brexit , a return to direct rule would be `` an abdication of responsibility '' .
`` those parties who went out and sought a big tough guy mandate yesterday , and got it in some respects , the pressure should be on them to actually deliver , '' she said .

documents.title: what next for stormont ? ni assembly election
text: sinn fein has made major gains in the northern ireland assembly election , finishing just one seat behind the democratic unionist party .
so what happens next at stormont after friday 's results ?

documents.title: sdlp 's mallon says party had 'good result '
text: nichola mallon says the sdlp taking 12 seats in the assembly election is a `` good result '' for her party .
the north belfast mla added : `` other parties played the sectarian card , they on issues that would divide people .
we did n't and we believe that we have seen an endorsement of that . ''

documents.title: elliott wo n't speculate on uup leadership
text: former ulster unionist leader , tom elliott , says he wo n't speculate on who might be the next leader of the party after mike nesbitt 's resignation .
when asked on bbc radio ulster if he would throw his hat into the ring , mr elliott said : `` once you 've done your term , it 's more difficult to go back and have another go . ''

documents.title: pressure on foster to resign , says ex-sf man
text: former sinn fein mla daithí mckay says that by resigning so quickly , uup leader mike nesbitt `` put pressure on arlene foster to follow suit '' .
when asked on radio ulster if he thinks mrs foster `` is toast '' , he replies `` i think she is '' .

documents.title: idea of opposition damaged says trimbleni assembly election
text: lord trimble says `` the idea of the opposition has been badly damaged '' by the election results .
`` that 's a bad thing . ''
he says the dup and sinn fein can reach an agreement `` if they want to '' , but believes there `` might be a little bit of posturing '' between the two parties .

documents.title: lyttle hails big result for alliance
text: alliance 1 & 2 in east belfast at # ae17 .
thank you for giving @ twitterid and i the privilege to represent this great constituency .
delighted to have both of you back .

well done guys

documents.title: ni as political entity 'in question '
text: former sdlp mla alban maginness says that `` what will now consume people is the very existence of this place as a political entity '' .
he says the middle ground has been rejected and if the dup and sinn fein do return to government it will be `` a rather steely co-existence that does n't represent real partnership '' .

documents.title: villiers hopes dup and sf can resolve differences
text: former northern ireland secretary theresa villiers hopes the dup and sinn fein can find a compromise so a return to direct rule can be avoided .

`` i hope they can find a way to resolve the differences between the two largest parties in northern ireland - it 's absolutely not in the interests of the people of northern ireland to return to direct rule , '' she says .

documents.title: trimble : 'give parties more time '
text: lord trimble , the former first minister of northern ireland has suggested that more time would be needed for the political parties at stormont to find agreement in the wake of friday 's election results .

lord trimble said : `` at the end of those two weeks if there is n't an administration put in place then the secretary of state for northern ireland is on a legal obligation to dissolve the assembly and have another general election which i doubt will get us anywhere . ''

documents.title: donaldson : 'lessons need to be learned'assembly election results reaction
text: sir jeffrey donaldson , says `` lessons need to be learned '' within unionism after friday 's assembly election results .
speaking on bbc radio 5live , the dup mp for lagan valley said it was a `` tight race '' between the dup and sinn fein .
he also added that the `` fracturing of unionism '' did not serve his party well and that they now need to `` listen to the concerns of the community . ''

documents.title: watch how it all unfoldedni assembly election
text: it was a day full of twists and turns , with some big names falling by the wayside .
watch how the results came in throughout friday .

documents.title: ó muilleoir congratulates final mla to be elected
text: sinn fein 's máirtín ó muilleoir congratulates the green party 's claire bailey , the final mla to be elected .
congrats ms bailey .
was in land of nod when votes concluded but remarkable result for you reflecting hard work record & inclusive approach

documents.title: nesbitt steps down as uup leaderni assembly election
text: while he retained his seat , mike nesbitt is probably the biggest casualty of the election , standing down as leader of the ulster unionist party .
you can watch his resignation speech here .
